alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyrimidine ring that bears a thioketone. Pyrimidine is a 6-membered ring consisting of four carbon atoms and two nitrogen centers at the 1- and 3- ring positions.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrimidinethiones

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a pyrimidine ring where the carbon at the 2-position involved in a C=S bond.
alternative_parents.name: 2-Thiopyrimidines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a hydrogenated pyrimidine ring (i.e. containing less than the maximum number of double bonds.).
alternative_parents.name: Hydropyrimidines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an amine group, which is indirectly attached to a carbonyl via an intervening vinyl (>C=C<) moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Vinylogous amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the thiourea functional group, a derivative of urea with the general structure (R1(N)R2C(=S)(R3)R4, R1-R4=H, alkyl, aryl), obtained by replacing the carbonyl group of urea with a thiocarbonyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Thioureas

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a lactam ring, which is a cyclic amide of amino carboxylic acids, having a 1-azacycloalkan-2-one structure (or an analogue having unsaturation or heteroatoms replacing one or more carbon atoms of the ring).
alternative_parents.name: Lactams

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organooxygen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds containing a five-member heterocyclic compound with five nitrogen atoms, and two nitrogen atoms at positions 1 and 2 (Pyridazines), 1 and 3 (Pyrimidines), or 1 and 4 (Pyrazines).
class.name: Diazines

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as pyrimidones. These are compounds that contain a pyrimidine ring, which bears a ketone. Pyrimidine is a 6-membered ring consisting of four carbon atoms and two nitrogen centers at the 1- and 3- ring positions.

direct_parent.description: Compounds that contain a pyrimidine ring, which bears a ketone. Pyrimidine is a 6-membered ring consisting of four carbon atoms and two nitrogen centers at the 1- and 3- ring positions.
direct_parent.name: Pyrimidones

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing a pyrimidne ring, which is a six-member aromatic heterocycle which consists of two nitrogen atoms (at positions 1 and 3) and four carbon atoms.
subclass.name: Pyrimidines and pyrimidine derivatives

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
